newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Industrials drive S.African stocks up, golds dip.
newsitem.headline: Industrials drive S.African stocks up, golds dip.

text.p: A runaway industrials sector pushed South African shares higher on Friday as the market started to recover from its battering of the last two weeks and shrugged off a sickly golds index.

Futures traders waded into the market to snap up baskets of shares and drove the industrial index up. Prices drifted down in the afternoon as futures trade faded away, but a late rally ensured the market finished firmly up.
"The market opened up strongly and then we had another rally in the last half an hour. It was like a breath of fresh air after recent weeks," one trader said.

Traders said futures players remained out of the market at the end. Instead the late surge had been sparked by a stronger rand and Wall Street's seemingly unstoppable bull run that gave a positive shot in the arm to the market's battered sentiment.
The industrial index jumped 68.1 points to end at 8,048.3 and pulled the all-share index up 26.5 points to 6,842.7.
There was some foreign buying in the market and local institutions were also in the hunt for shares as trading volumes hit healthy levels.
However, gold shares took a hammering as the bullion price slipped overnight in New York. A temporary halt in Hong Kong provided brief relief before European markets opened and the fall resumed.
The gold index dipped 22.7 points, or 1.3 percent,to 1,720.9.
